defaultBid.description: A bid value for use when no bid is specified for keywords in the ad group. For more information about bid constraints by marketplace, see [bid limits](https://advertising.amazon.com/API/docs/en-us/concepts/limits#bid-constraints-by-marketplace).

name.description: The name of the ad group.

retailerId.description: Id of retailer targeted by the ad group

helpUrl.description: A URL with additional information about the status identifier.

message.description: A human-readable description of the status identifier specified in the name field.

RASv1AutoMatchType.description: The match type for the auto target.

RASv1BiddingStrategy.description:
The bidding strategy.
| Value | Strategy name | Description |
|----------------|---------------|-------------|
| `MANUAL` | Fixed bid | Uses your exact bid and any placement adjustments you set, and is not subject to dynamic bidding. |
| `LEGACY_FOR_SALES` | Dynamic bids - down only | Amazon will reduce your bids for clicks that may be less likely
 to convert to a sale.|
| `AUTO_FOR_SALES` | Dynamic bids - up and down| Amazon will increase your bids in for clicks that may be more
likely to convert to a sale. With this strategy, and reduce your bids for clicks that are less likely to convert to
 a sale. |

startDate.description: Campaign start date. Default: today's date. The format of the date is YYYY-MM-DD.

RASv1EntityState.description:
The current resource state.
| State | Description |
| --- | --- |
| `ENABLED` | Enabled State |
| `PAUSED` | Paused State |
| `ARCHIVED` | ARCHIVED State |

RASv1InternalServerError.description: Error that represents non-retryable API service error. Sending the same request will result in another error.

RASv1OtherError.description: Errors not related to any of the other error types

RASv1Placement.description:
You can enable controls to adjust your bid based on the placement location. Specify a location where you want to use bid controls. The percentage value set is the percentage of the original bid for which you want to have your bid adjustment increased. For example, a 50% adjustment on a $1.00 bid would increase the bid to $1.50 for the opportunity to win a specified placement.
| Predicate |  Placement |
|-----------|------------|
| `PLACEMENT_TOP` | Top of search (first page) |
| `PLACEMENT_REST_OF_SEARCH` | Rest of the search (first page) |
| `PLACEMENT_PRODUCT_PAGE` | Product page |
| `PLACEMENT_TOP_BROWSE` | Top of browse |
| `PLACEMENT_BROWSE_OTHER` | Rest of browse |

RASv1QueryTermMatchType.description:
Match type for query filters.
| Value |  Description |
|-----------|------------|
| `BROAD_MATCH` | Match if the queried value contains the filter value. (substring matching) |
| `EXACT_MATCH` | Match if the queried value is exactly equivalent to the filter value. |

info.description: The API that enables advertisers to run campaigns through Amazon Ads on retailers that are launched on Amazon Retail Ad Service
info.title: Amazon Advertiser API for Retail Ad Service

parameters.description: The identifier of a client associated with a "Login with Amazon" account.
parameters.name: Amazon-Advertising-API-ClientId

schema.description: The identifier of a client associated with a "Login with Amazon" account.

parameters.description:
The identifier of a profile associated with the advertiser account. Use GET method on Profiles resource to list
profiles associated with the access token passed in the HTTP Authorization header.
parameters.name: Amazon-Advertising-API-Scope

schema.description:
The identifier of a profile associated with the advertiser account. Use GET method on Profiles resource to list
profiles associated with the access token passed in the HTTP Authorization header.

parameters.description:
The "Prefer" header, as defined in [RFC7240], allows clients to request certain behavior from the service.
The service ignores preference values that are either not supported or not known by the service.
Either multiple Prefer headers are passed or single one with comma separated values, both forms are equivalent
Supported preferences:
return=representation - return the full object when doing create/update/delete operations instead of ids.
parameters.name: Prefer

Supported preferences:
